intro: Lepturus simplex, commonly known as the simple lepturus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale blue. The plant is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in the Andean foothills. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
